column1: #Text=The polycrystalline samples of UBe13−xAlx (0 ≤ x ≤ 0.60), as well as the binary compounds UAl2 and UAl3 (NMR reference material) were synthesized by arc melting of the elemental metals, using U (sheet, Good Fellow, >99.95 wt.%), Be (sheet, Heraeus, >99.9 wt.%), and Al (droplets, Chempur, 99.999 wt.%).
#Text=A small excess of Be was added to compensate for the material loss due to evaporation (typically 1.5–1.7 wt.%).
#Text=Complete sample preparation was performed in Ar-filled glove boxes (MBraun, p(H2O/O2) < 0.1 ppm), dedicated to the handling of U- and Be-containing samples65.
#Text=The polycrystalline samples were annealed in alumina crucibles under Ar atmosphere.
#Text=Large, mm-sized, cube-shaped single crystals of UBe13−xAlx were grown using Al flux.
#Text=Arc melted specimens of U with Be and Al (U:Be:Al atomic ratio of 1:18:35) were placed in a BeO crucible.
#Text=The crucible was then sealed under Ar atmosphere in a tantalum tube and placed in a furnace (LORA, HTM Reetz).
#Text=The samples were heated up and kept at 1500 °C for 72 h and then cooled at 3 °C h−1 to room temperature.
#Text=The crystals were isolated by selective dissolution of the Al flux in an aqueous NaOH solution (2 mol L−1).
